how_data_privacy: Federated learning is used to ensure sensitive data remains in local environments, minimizing direct data exposure. This approach is designed to fight against common threats and privacy attacks, but specific potential flaws are not detailed in the description.

The competition uses synthetic datasets to mitigate privacy risks. Solutions must prevent unintended disclosure of sensitive information by leveraging privacy-preserving techniques, addressing potential flaws through comprehensive threat assessments.
how_transparency: n/a, metric: Area Under the Precision–Recall Curve (AUPRC)

how_data_privacy: The competition involves handling sensitive financial and personal data, requiring privacy preservation through federated learning. Privacy-enhancing solutions aim to prevent data disclosure to unauthorized parties, adhering to threat models, but the synthetic nature of data minimizes real privacy risk.
how_transparency: n/a, evaluates performance using Area Under the Precision–Recall Curve (AUPRC) only.

how_data_privacy: The competition focuses on enhancing privacy in federated learning to protect sensitive data. Blue Teams develop solutions to protect input and output privacy, and Red Teams test these solutions for robustness against privacy attacks.
